summary: the last study on sickle cell disease (SCD) was done in the early 1980s. the country is known as endemic for malaria and respiratory infections. the main objective of this study was to estimate the prevalence of SCD. bSS phenotype was associated with higher risk of parechovirus infection (adjusted OR = 6.0; 95% CI: 1.1–31.3, p = 0.03) compared to HbAA.
